page.title: 05CLYDEBANK BUSINESS PARK
page.content: The{Clydebank Task Force}was set up in March 1980 on the recommendation of the working party on employment in Clydebank.The Task Force is staffed by members of Area Development Directorate of the S.D.A. The{Clydebank Business Park}has a commercial floorspace of{820,000 sq.ft By 1985{720,000 sq.ft}was occupied by over 300 small businesses which employ a total work-force of 3000. The Clydebank Business Park was founded to cope with the 10,000+ people who were made redundant between 1976-80,by the closure of 13 major companies which includes the Singers sewing machine works and John Browns ship-building Co.Between{1980-85 around{ 1500}jobs have been created by the Business Park out of the 3000 total now employed in 1985.
